content:
We get two smaller solenoids with weaker magnetic properties.

The field lines remain continuous, emerging from one face of the solenoid and entering into the other face.

One can test this analogy by moving a small compass needle in the neighbourhood of a bar magnet and a current-carrying finite solenoid and noting that the deflections of the needle are similar in both cases.
header_path: 5.2.2 Bar magnet as an equivalent solenoid
summary: To understand the magnetic field distribution near a bar magnet, an analogy can be drawn with a finite solenoid, as their field lines are similar and the deflections of a compass needle are similar.
hypothetical_questions: What is the difference between a bar magnet and a solenoid?
What are the field lines of a bar magnet?
